photos.alt: Looking at the mountain tops blending into the vibrant blue sky. Bright yellow aspen trees mix with evergreens to create a mottled mountainscape.
photos.detail: September is prime leaf peeping season in Colorado. The Aspens turn vibrant yellow and make for some beautiful hikes!

photos.alt: A photo of the horizon from the POV of a passanger in a car. The sky is filled with large, white clouds. The ground is brown desert with one road traveling to the horizon. There are plataus and mountains in the distance.
photos.detail: The drive from Orangeville, Utah to Denver, Colorado is one seemingly endless stretch of desert. Storm clouds and distant plateaus are the only indication you're actually covering any ground.

photos.alt: Looking out a wooden window at a green hills and snow topped mountatin peaks
photos.detail: In the quiet village of Cavagnago, there is a little cabin perched on the hill. The old, wood windows give you a glimpse of the mountain peaks. A truly unforgettable sight!

photos.alt: Pink and green Northern Lights radiate. Scattered stars and a silhouette of a person sitting.
photos.detail: A very spontaneous trip to Wyoming to see the Northern Lights paid off with many vivid colors.

photos.alt: Orange sunset begins on the peaks of the Swiss Alps. Below is a green valley with small buildings and many trees.
photos.detail: The hike down from the boulders in Cresciano was a long one, but getting to see the sun set over the Swiss Alps was very special.

photos.alt: A deep, red canyon on a misty, rainy day with many snaking ridges and a blanket of cloud in the sky.
photos.detail: Due to rain, our climbing trip in Utah was cut short. We didn't want to go home yet, so we took a detour and vistied Canyonlands National Park. The dreary rain clouds added a moody-ness to the vast canyons.

photos.location: Lincoln Lake, Mount Blue Sky, Colorado
photos.alt: A valley filled with blue waters mirroring a vivid blue sky. Many large boulders have fallen into the lake.
photos.detail: Lincoln Lake is a particularly beloved bouldering destination. At 12,000 ft elevation there isn't much life. Yet, somehow there are fish in the lake and mountain goats and pikas in the valleys.

photographers.name: Ingeborg `Georgie` Adolfs
photographers.bio: Amateur photographer who loves all things nature
